issue.title: Simple Notes CLI
issue.body:
## Build a simple CLI notes app

A command-line notes application in TypeScript.

**Features:**
- Add notes with title and content
- List all notes
- Delete notes by ID
- Search notes

**Tech:**
- TypeScript
- Node.js CLI with commander.js
- JSON file storage

Keep it simple - just the CLI, no UI.

ems.task: Set up project foundation with .gitignore (node_modules, .env, *.log), package.json with TypeScript, commander.js, and ts-node dev dependencies, tsconfig.json with ES2020 target and commonjs module
ems.error: No workers merged - all had conflicts

ems.task: Create src/types.ts defining Note interface (id, title, content, timestamp) and NotesStorage interface with load, save, add, delete, search, and getAll methods

workers.task: Create src/types.ts defining Note interface (id, title, content, timestamp) and NotesStorage interface with load, save, add, delete, search, and getAll methods

ems.task: Implement src/storage.ts with JSONFileStorage class - handles reading/writing notes.json, generating UUIDs, and implementing all NotesStorage methods
Create src/cli.ts using commander.js - configure CLI program with version, description, and subcommands (add, list, delete, search)
Implement src/commands/add.ts - 'add' command with --title <title> and --content <content> options, creates note via storage and displays success message
Implement src/commands/list.ts - 'list' command that retrieves all notes from storage and displays them in formatted table (ID, Title, Content, Date)
Implement src/commands/delete.ts - 'delete' command with --id <id> option, validates ID exists, removes note via storage, and confirms deletion
Implement src/commands/search.ts - 'search' command with --query <text> option, searches note titles and content via storage, displays matching notes
Create src/index.ts as main entry point that initializes storage with default notes.json path, registers all commands with CLI, and parses arguments

analysisSummary: Build a TypeScript CLI notes app with commander.js, using JSON file storage. Supports adding notes (title + content), listing all notes, deleting by ID, and searching notes.
